Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • Graph

  • public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for managing the map where the ants move.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Graph(int width, int depth, Colony[] homes, double sugarProbability, int avgSugar)
      Creates a new rectangular grid graph with the specified home nodes randomly placed.
      Graph(String filename, Colony[] homes, double sugarProbability, int avgSugar)
      Reads a graph from a file.

    • Method Summary

      Returns the level of pheromones in the edge between two nodes in this graph.

      Increases the level of pheromones in an edge between two nodes in this graph by the given amount.
      void tick()
      Simulates the passing of a unit of time, by decreasing the pheromone levels in all edges in this graph and possibly spawning sugar in a random node.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Graph

        public Graph(int width,
             int depth,
             Colony[] homes,
             double sugarProbability,
             int avgSugar)
        Creates a new rectangular grid graph with the specified home nodes randomly placed. Some nodes randomly get assigned some sugar.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the grid
        depth - the depth of the grid
        homes - the home nodes to place
        sugarProbability - the probability that each node gets sugar
        avgSugar - the average sugar generated at nodes that get sugar

      • Graph

        public Graph(String filename,
             Colony[] homes,
             double sugarProbability,
             int avgSugar)
        Reads a graph from a file. Some nodes randomly get assigned some sugar.

        The file structure is as follows: one line containing the number of nodes (including colonies); one line containing the nodes corresponding to colonies; and a variable number of lines describing edges (one per line). The nodes are assumed to be numbered sequentially from 1, and each edge is described by a pair of numbers (the source and target nodes of the edge).

        Precondition: the number of elements in homes is exactly the number of home nodes as given in the file AND there are no duplicate edges.

        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to read from
        homes - the references to the home nodes
        sugarProbability - the probability that each node gets sugar
        avgSugar - the average sugar generated at nodes that get sugar

    • Method Detail

      • adjacentTo

        public Node[] adjacentTo(Node node)
        Returns the list of nodes in this graph that are adjacent to a given node.

        Precondition: the given node must be a node in this graph

        Parameters:
        node - the source node
        Returns:
        a list of all nodes connected to the given node

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Simulates the passing of a unit of time, by decreasing the pheromone levels in all edges in this graph and possibly spawning sugar in a random node. The chance of spawning sugar and the expected amount of generated sugar are the same as in the initial setup of this graph.

      • raisePheromones

        public void raisePheromones(Node source,
                            Node target,
                            int amount)
        Increases the level of pheromones in an edge between two nodes in this graph by the given amount.

        Precondition: there must be an edge between the two nodes.

        Parameters:
        source - the source node of the edge
        target - the target node of the edge
        amount - the amount of pheromones to add

      • pheromoneLevel

        public int pheromoneLevel(Node source,
                          Node target)
        Returns the level of pheromones in the edge between two nodes in this graph. If there is no edge between the two nodes, the method returns zero.

        Parameters:
        source - the source node of the edge
        target - the target node of the edge
        Returns:
        the level of pheromones in the edge between the nodes
